intro: Acroceras basicladum, commonly known as the roughleaf acroceras, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
